sen.j: 父は大伴武以（たけもち）とされるが（『公卿補任』）、世代が合わないので不審。
sen.e: According to the "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles), his father is thought to be OTOMO no Takemochi but this is unconvinced because of the different generations.

sen.j: 佐伯氏の祖（『新撰姓氏録』）。
sen.e: He was Saeki clan's ancestor.

sen.j: 允恭天皇から顕宗天皇まで5代の天皇に大連 (古代日本)（おおむらじ）として仕えた（『公卿補任』）。
sen.e: According to the "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles), he served five emperors from Emperor Ingyo to Emperor Kenzo as Omuraji (hereditary title).

sen.j: 允恭天皇（仁徳天皇の皇子）の代、妃の衣通姫（そとおりのいらつめ）のために藤原部を定める。
sen.e: In the Emperor Ingyo (Prince of Emperor Nintoku) era, he set up Fujiwarabe for Princess SOTORI no Iratsune.
In the period of Emperor Ingyo (son of Emperor Nintoku), he set up Fujiwarabe for Princess SOTOORI no Iratsume.
sen.cmt: ・(Prince of Emperor Nintoku)→(son of Emperor Nintoku)・In the Emperor Ingyo (Prince of Emperor Nintoku) era,→In the period of Emperor Ingyo (son of Emperor Nintoku),・for Princess SOTORI no Iratsune→for Princess SOTOORI no Iratsume
sen.e: In the period of Emperor Ingyo (son of Emperor Nintoku), he set up Fujiwarabe for Princess SOTOORI no Iratsume.

sen.j: 雄略天皇2年（458年）、百済の池津媛を犯した石川楯を、来目部に命じて処刑させる。
sen.e: He ordered kumebe (guard) to execute ISHIKAWA no tate who raped IKETSU no Hime.
In 458, Emperor Yuryaku ordered Kumebe (a guard) to execute ISHIKAWA no Tate due to committing misconduct with IKETSU no Hime of Baekje.
sen.cmt: ・In 458を追加しました。・He ordered→Emperor Yuryaku ordered・kumebe (guard)→Kumebe (a guard)・ISHIKAWA no tate→ISHIKAWA no Tate・who raped IKETSU no Hime→due to committing misconduct with IKETSU no Hime of Baekje
sen.e: In 458, Emperor Yuryaku ordered Kumebe (a guard) to execute ISHIKAWA no Tate due to committing misconduct with IKETSU no Hime of Baekje.

sen.j: 同23年（479年）8月、天皇崩御に際して後事を託され、直後に起こった星川皇子の叛乱を東漢掬と共に鎮圧。
sen.e: In August of the same year 479, he was charged with the future affairs when the Emperor had died and put down HOSHIKAWA no Miko rebellion with Yamatonoayano Tsuka.
In 479, after the death of Emperor Yuryaku, Muroya was charged with the future affairs and suppressed HOSHIKAWA no Miko insurrection with Yamatonoaya no Tsuka.
sen.cmt: ・In August of the same year 479→In 479・when the Emperor had died→after the death of Emperor Yuryaku・he→Muroya・put down→suppressed・rebellion→insurrection・Yamatonoayano Tsuka→Yamatonoaya no Tsuka
sen.e: In 479, after the death of Emperor Yuryaku, Muroya was charged with the future affairs and suppressed HOSHIKAWA no Miko insurrection with Yamatonoaya no Tsuka.

sen.j: 清寧天皇2年（481年）には、諸国に天皇の部民制品部（しなべ）、部曲・民部（かきべ）、子代（こしろ）・名代（なしろ）・御名代（みなしろ）として白髪部舎人・膳夫（かしわで）・靱負（ゆげい）を置いた。
sen.e: In 481, he introduces Emperor's bemin sei (the system of Yamato Dynasty) to the various countries; assigned shirakabe toneri (a serf), kashiwade (a cook), yugei (a guard) as replacement for shinabe, buqu, kakibe, nashiro, minashiro.

sen.j: 武烈天皇3年（501年）天皇の詔に従い、役丁を徴発して城の形を水派邑（みまたのむら、奈良県河合町か）に築いた（ただし、これは金村の事績とすべき）。
sen.e: Followed imperial rescript in 501, he gathered ekicho (construction workers) forcibly and built castle shape in Mimatanomura (present Kawai town, Nara Prefecture) but this should be Kanemura's achievement.

Followed the imperial rescript of Emperor Buretsu in 501, he gathered ekicho (construction workers) forcibly and built the substructure of a castle in Mimatanomura (present Kawai town, Nara Prefecture) but this should be Kanemura's achievement.
